result.execSummary:
The defendant Noe G Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine/costs and DNA & Drug Abuse Surcharges.  Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noe G Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Noe G Garcia
Current: 3100 Wisconsin Street, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 09-28-2015)
Prior: 3520 Patti #4, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Noe G Garcia in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:35 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea/sentencing hearing. There is an agreement.
Defendant is pleading to Count 1.  Count 2 is being dismissed and read in.

State recommends a fine and costs.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Possession of THC
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $25 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

Defendant works at DelMonte.

$500 sig bond: Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Noe G Garcia in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered
BTC: $500 sig bond:  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
